title: Paleo Caldereta - Filipino Beef Stew
directions: Puree liverwurst, tomato sauce, and tomato paste in a food processor or blender.
Season beef with salt and pepper.

Heat a dutch oven to medium and add 1T of lard/cooking fat. Sautee the carrots, onions, chile pepper flakes, and garlic and cook until almost translucent. Add the chopped tomato and turn to low. Simmer for about 1-2 minutes and turn off the heat.
Heat a skillet to medium high. Add 1T of lard/cooking fat. Add the seasoned beef and cook until brown.
Transfer the browned meat from the skillet to the dutch oven.
Combine the soy sauce/coconut aminos and vinegar in a glass and pour over the skillet to deglaze the beef bits. Transfer all of that into the dutch oven.
Add the pureed liverwurst tomato sauce, beef broth, paprika, and bay leaves to the dutch oven. Mix until combined.
Cover the dutch oven and place in the oven, centered.
Bake at 325F for 60 minutes. Add the green beans, stir, and bake covered for another 20 minutes.
Add the bell peppers and bake for 10 minutes more.
Alternatively, you can steam the green beans and mix them into the finished stew (braised for about 80 minutes) to keep its pretty green color.
Enjoy with steamed white rice or steamed cauliflower!
ingredients: 1½ Cups of Carrot Discs, about 3-4 carrots
1 Tablespoon of Dried Red Chile Flakes
⅓ cup of Coconut Aminos/Soy Sauce
2 cups of Beef or Bone Broth
1 Tablespoon of Hungarian Paprika (or standard paprika)
2 Tablespoons of Lard or Cooking Fat
